children.text: The waterproofing membrane in this area is starting to delaminate from the substrate, indicating that either the substrate has not been properly cleaned and primed, or the waterproofing membrane has not been properly installed.
Part 3.8.1.2 of the NCC's Building Code of Australia (BCA) - Wet Areas, states that;
‘Building elements in wet areas within a building must be waterproof or water resistant in accordance with Table 3.8.1.1; and comply with AS 3740’ .
Additionally, the builder warrants that the work will be carried out in
, which is not the case in this area.
These areas must be rectified to be fully waterproofed to protect the building elements from damage in accordance with the BCA, Australian Standards and manufacturer’s requirements.
